result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. John D Tucker

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Affidavit for Services Rendered filed by Atty Babe.
Defendant John D Tucker in court with attorney Katie Elizabeth Babe.  Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The charge is dismissed and read into 15CM347.
Plea hearing at 01-25-2016 03:30 pm

Defendant John D Tucker in court with attorney Katie Elizabeth Babe.  Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Attorney Babe advises the Court the parties have a joint request to adjourn the trial to allow for the Defendant to complete his treatment.  The Court sets the matter for a plea hearing on Monday to allow for the parties to reached a final agreement.  The trial remains as set on 15CM347.  Plea hearing scheduled for January 25, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
Treatment letter filed.

Defendant John D Tucker in court with attorney Katie Elizabeth Babe.  Andrea M. Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Babe requests an adjournment of the trial to allow for additional trial preparation.  The Court denies the request and the trial remains as set on 15CM347.
Hearing at 01-21-2016 08:30 am
Hearing at 12-02-2015 08:30 am

Defendant John D Tucker in court with attorney Katie Elizabeth Babe.  Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Attorney Babe advises that she is waiting for files from the previous counsel. The Court sets the matter for trial on case 15CM347.  This case to tag along. If Attorney Babe would like the case to resolve prior to the jury trial she should notify the clerk's office to make arrangements.  Hearing scheduled for December 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Hearing scheduled for January 21, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Hearing at 10-28-2015 09:00 am
Defendant to pay: $100.00 Per month commencing 11/1/15.
Hearing at 10-28-2015 09:00 am

Defendant John D Tucker in court with attorney Amy C Scholz.  Mary C. Brejcha appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Motion to withdraw as counsel was previously filed. Court grants motion to withdraw as counsel.   Defendant requests the court appoint counsel. Clerk swears defendant. Court grants request, repayment at rate of $100.00 per month commencing November 1, 2015.  Hearing scheduled for October 28, 2015 at 09:00 am.
filed by Attorney Scholz dated 10/02/2015
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 5, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Defendant John D Tucker in court with attorney Amy C Scholz.  Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense has been working on a consolidation with the cases in Waukesha and Milwaukee county. Defense advises they will now resolve the cases independently. Court will give a plea/sentencing date in 45 days.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 5, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Hearing on August 21, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Defendant John D Tucker in court with attorney Amy C Scholz.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense is still working to consolidate the defendant's matters and requests another date. Court grants request.  Hearing scheduled for August 21, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Hearing on July 7, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Hearing on June 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant John D Tucker in court with attorney Amy C Scholz.  Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant has another case on 6-15-15 in intake court.  Atty. Scholz requests a new date to try to consolidate all cases.  Hearing scheduled for June 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Hearing on June 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant John D Tucker in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court will give another date in a few weeks.   Defendant might seek counsel. Defendant is involved in counseling. Defendant to advise how he wants to proceed on the next date.  Hearing scheduled for June 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Hearing on May 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant is not to have any violent/abusive contact with the Karen S.   Defendant is not to possess any knives/weapons/firearms.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.

Defendant John D Tucker in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court advises of right to an attorney. Defendant would like to accept the state's pre-trial offer.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
  Hearing scheduled for May 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.
